title: Ask HN: What are alternative ways of publishing a mobile app successfully?
text:
Who is running a success Mobile App without using Google/Apple app store and how are you doing?

I would like to know how we can deliver our apps in the future, without a detached gatekeeper who believes that having a canned-bot reply to your email consitudes as 'Good service'.

Backstory: We run a SaaS business telco which focusses on privacy. Needless to say, our mobile app is important to our customers. We are currently experiencing a problem publishing new app versions to Google Play, our app is being flagged as “uploading user’s contact data without consent”. We obviously aren’t doing this, but we also don’t know why Google thinks that we are and it’s not possible to speak to a real person, you only get automated responses when you try and appeal it.

Blog post: A longer blog story in Dutch: https://www.voys.nl/blog/hoe-google-ons-dwingt-onze-open-source-app-slechter-te-maken/

Ask HN: What SaaS products would you say are your “daily drivers”?
text:
What SaaS products would you say that you use more often than not? Any favorites?

I'm working on a small project which will you to use shortcuts and commands within your browser (https://www.CTRL1.io) and I wanted to integrate your favorites first.
